results.title: Why did you leave such a beautiful place?
results.creator_credit: Margaret O'Connell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Margaret O’Connell tells of how she moved to be with her sister in Geelong, of her first days at Brintons carpet factory and how her loneliness was soon replaced by the family she made there. She join the Equal Opportunity and Consultative Committees and, when the factory closed in 2008, had been there for 32 years.

results.title: The Honeymoon
results.creator_credit: Laurel Whitcroft (Allen) and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. A family album of the holidays in the Victorian Alps taken initially by Laurel and her husband for their honeymoon, then the subsequent returns by the growing family throughout the decades.
results.description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. results.title: The Journey begins at midnight
results.creator_credit: Joseph Jovic and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Josip tells of his upbringing on a farm in Coatia and how the lure of a better life brought him to Australia, Geelong and, eventually, to Brintons Carpets. Learning English within a few years, Josip soon became a shop steward and a representative on the Consultative Committee and he tells of the closure of Brintons and how it led to his retirement.

results.title: The Soul of St Kilda
results.brief_description: Like some other residents, Meyer believes that St Kilda Town Hall is the heart of the community. He takes us through the rich history that is on display on the walls of this great building.

results.title: Nihiwatu
results.creator_credit: Christiana Stergiou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: On the remote Indonesian island of Sumba is the village of Nihiwatu, a place that can only be found in the Ethical Travel Guide. It was here that Christiana Stergiou discovered her utopia, and a place that, despite being a seasoned traveller, she will never forget.

results.title: See me
results.brief_description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.
results.description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.

results.title: In search of golden footprints
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swift and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.

results.title: Home in the high country
results.creator_credit: Trevor Larner and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Trevor Larner first discovered the Victorian high country as a teenager. He initially wanted to get to the highest point, but then fell in love with the vegetation and beauty of the Alpine region. Eventually he started working there maintaining infrastructure, building ski lodges and repairing the huts of the early pioneers. When Trevor went back to visit in 2008, it felt like he was coming home.
